body_html:
@mrry sorry I didn't explain right. It is not a crash but just a UnavailableError exception and Exit(code: 1), so there won't be a core dump I think.
Anyway, today I dig into the source code and location the failing position:
in tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/grpc_session.cc line 186:
TF_RETURN_IF_ERROR(RunProto(&call_options, &req, &resp));
I found a timeout option in the call_options, and I suspect big RNN will cause a timeout. I try to set a
run_options = tf.RunOptions(trace_level=tf.RunOptions.FULL_TRACE, timeout_in_ms=10000000) when I call outputs = session.run(output_feed, input_feed, options=run_options). and now is trying to see if it can pass through.
Appreciate to have your suggestions...

body:
@mrry sorry I didn't explain right. It is not a crash but just a UnavailableError exception and Exit(code: 1), so there won't be a core dump I think. 
Anyway, today I dig into the source code and location the failing position:  
in **tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/grpc_session.cc** line 186: 
**TF_RETURN_IF_ERROR(RunProto(&call_options, &req, &resp));**
I found a timeout option in the **call_options**, and I suspect big RNN will cause a timeout. I try to set a 
**run_options = tf.RunOptions(trace_level=tf.RunOptions.FULL_TRACE, timeout_in_ms=10000000)** when I call **outputs = session.run(output_feed, input_feed, options=run_options).** and now is trying to see if it can pass through. 
Appreciate to have your suggestions...
